alert.note: Alert for Avery; Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL MCDOWELL...SOUTHEASTERN MITCHELL...WEST CENTRAL CALDWELL...SOUTHERN AVERY...NORTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE...SOUTHEASTERN YANCEY AND NORTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Newland to near Spruce Pine to 12 miles northeast of Downtown Asheville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Marion, Newland, Black Mountain, Old Fort, Crossnore, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Linville Falls, and B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Buncombe; Burke Mountains; Caldwell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
